TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MobileCapabilities extends System.Web.HttpBrowserCapabilities

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Provides a single source for accessing capability information about a client device and for performing queries against device capabilities. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.permission: für den Betrieb in einer gehosteten Umgebung. "Demand"-Wert: ; Berechtigungswert: .

Docs.summary: Creates an instance of the class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool HasCapability (string delegateName, string optionalParameter);
.method public hidebysig instance bool HasCapability(string delegateName, string optionalParameter) cil managed
Public Function HasCapability (delegateName As String, optionalParameter As String) As Boolean
public: bool HasCapability(System::String ^ delegateName, System::String ^ optionalParameter);

Docs.param: The device evaluation method, property name, or item in the capabilities collection.
Docs.summary: Provides a uniform way to evaluate device capabilities. This method is used internally by ASP.NET to implement various device-selection criteria expressed in the syntax of the controls. For example, this method is used to choose among [<Choice> Element (.NET Framework Developer's Guide)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/c81bee77-bb45-4211-be0f-e13a040b3c2d) elements in a DeviceSpecific/Choice construct. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.returns: if the device has the specified capability; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Anwendungen können die <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.HasCapability%2A> Methode, programmgesteuert auf, wenn sie Geräte-spezifischer Informationen sammeln. Wenn die `capabilityName` Parameter gibt eine Auswertungsmethode Gerät die `optionalArgument` Parameter an diese Methode übergeben wird. Wenn die `capabilityName` Parameter gibt einen Eigenschaftsnamen oder ein Element im Funktionswörterbuch der <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.HasCapability%2A> Methode überprüft, ob die Eigenschaft oder ein Element entspricht der `optionalArgument` Parameter.

Docs.exception: A parameter is not found as a device-filter name specified in the configuration file, as a property, or as an item in the Item collection.
